001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.service.fluent;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.Storage;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.interceptor.ApiResponse;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.storage.StorageKeysUi;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core.AssertionResult;
007import io.qameta.allure.Allure;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * A fluent service for handling API response validation and interception.
012 *
013 * <p>This service provides methods to validate API responses stored in the UI storage,
014 * ensuring that requests contain expected status codes.
015 *
016 * <p>The generic type {@code T} represents the UI service fluent implementation that extends {@link UiServiceFluent},
017 * allowing method chaining for seamless interaction.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public class InterceptorServiceFluent<T extends UiServiceFluent<?>> {
022
023   private final T uiServiceFluent;
024   private final Storage storage;
025
026   /**
027    * Constructs an {@code InterceptorServiceFluent} instance.
028    *
029    * @param uiServiceFluent The UI service fluent instance to maintain fluent method chaining.
030    * @param storage         The storage instance where API responses are stored for validation.
031    */
032   public InterceptorServiceFluent(T uiServiceFluent, Storage storage) {
033      this.uiServiceFluent = uiServiceFluent;
034      this.storage = storage;
035   }
036
037   /**
038    * Validates that all API responses matching a given URL substring have a status code
039    * starting with the specified prefix.
040    *
041    * @param requestUrlSubString The substring to match against API response URLs.
042    * @param statusPrefix        The expected status code prefix (e.g., 2 for 200-level responses).
043    * @return The current {@link UiServiceFluent} instance for method chaining.
044    */
045   public T validateResponseHaveStatus(final String requestUrlSubString, int statusPrefix) {
046      Allure.step(
047            "Validate that all API responses containing URL substring: " + requestUrlSubString + " have status prefix: "
048                  + statusPrefix);
049      return validateResponseHaveStatus(requestUrlSubString, statusPrefix, false);
050   }
051
052   /**
053    * Validates that all API responses matching a given URL substring have a status code
054    * starting with the specified prefix, with an option for soft assertions.
055    *
056    * @param requestUrlSubString The substring to match against API response URLs.
057    * @param statusPrefix        The expected status code prefix (e.g., 2 for 200-level responses).
058    * @param soft                {@code true} if the assertion should be a soft assertion,
059    *                            allowing the test to continue even if it fails.
060    * @return The current {@link UiServiceFluent} instance for method chaining.
061    */
062   public T validateResponseHaveStatus(final String requestUrlSubString, int statusPrefix,
063                                       boolean soft) {
064      List<ApiResponse> apiResponses = (List<ApiResponse>) storage.sub(StorageKeysUi.UI)
065            .getByClass(StorageKeysUi.RESPONSES, Object.class);
066
067      List<ApiResponse> filteredResponses = apiResponses.stream()
068            .filter(apiResponse -> apiResponse.getUrl().contains(requestUrlSubString))
069            .toList();
070
071      boolean isPassed = filteredResponses.stream()
072            .allMatch(apiResponse -> validateStatus(statusPrefix, apiResponse.getStatus()));
073
074      AssertionResult<?> result = new AssertionResult<>(isPassed,
075            String.format("Validating API requests containing: %s have correct status: %d",
076                  requestUrlSubString, statusPrefix),
077            true, isPassed, soft);
078
079      List<AssertionResult<Object>> validationResults = List.of((AssertionResult<Object>) result);
080      uiServiceFluent.validation(validationResults);
081      return uiServiceFluent;
082   }
083
084   /**
085    * Checks whether a given status code starts with the specified prefix.
086    *
087    * @param prefix The expected status code prefix.
088    * @param status The actual status code.
089    * @return {@code true} if the status code starts with the prefix, otherwise {@code false}.
090    */
091   private boolean validateStatus(int prefix, int status) {
092      String prefixStr = String.valueOf(prefix);
093      String statusStr = String.valueOf(status);
094      return statusStr.startsWith(prefixStr);
095   }
096
097}
